events.title: AUMzing Talent
events.description: An activity to show the nine emotions that form the essence of performing arts - Navarasa.
events.longDescription: AUmazing Talent is a unique talent showcase event dedicated to the theme of Navaras - the nine emotions that form the essence of performing arts. The event aims to bring together individuals who can express these emotions through various art forms, providing a stage for performers to showcase their talent through diverse performances. The event is open to all art forms, including dance, music, theatre, poetry, and any other creative expressions that depict the nine rasas: Shringara (Love), Hasya (Laughter), Karuna (Compassion), Raudra (Anger), Veera (Heroism), Bhayanaka (Fear), Bibhatsa (Disgust), Adbhuta (Wonder), and Shanta (Peace).Performances: Open to dance, music that embodies Navarasa.
rules: Rule 1: Content should be original and expressive
Rule 2: Performances must align with one or more of the nine rasas
Rule 3: Time limit 5 mins maximum

events.title: Jab We Code
events.description: A unique coding contest where teams of two switch contests midway and strategize together in the final phase. The final score is based on combined contest performance.
events.longDescription: Jab We Code is a unique programming contest that tests teamwork, adaptability, and strategic decision-making. Teams of two begin by solving separate contests (Contest A and Contest B) for 30 minutes before discussing their progress and swapping challenges. After another 30 minutes, they strategize once more before entering the final 20-minute phase, where both contests are open, and members decide who tackles which problem. The final ranking is determined by the combined scores of both contests. The top three teams win cash prizes.
rules: Rule 1: Teams consist of two members
Rule 2: Each member starts solving a separate coding contest
Rule 3: After 30 minutes, a 5-minute discussion is allowed before switching contests
Rule 4: After another 30 minutes, teams get a final 5-minute discussion
Rule 5: The last 20 minutes allow both members to work on separate contests simultaneously
Rule 6: The teamâ€™s total score determines the winners

events.title: Hackathon 2025 2
events.description: Join us for a 24-hour coding marathon where innovation meets technology. Build, create, and compete with the best minds in the field.

rules: Rule 1: Teams must consist of 2-4 members
Rule 2: All code must be written during the hackathon
Rule 3: Use of open source libraries is allowed
Rule 4: Projects must be original work
Rule 5: Submission deadline is strict
Rule 6: Code must be pushed to GitHub
Rule 7: Live presentation is mandatory
